title:
Way to Health
Rehabilitation Center for Ukrainian War Victims
subtitle: Helping war-injured individuals return to full and meaningful lives
introduction: Way to Health is a medical center established on August 1, 2022, dedicated to providing high-quality rehabilitation services to Ukrainian war victims. Our mission is to help all people affected by war return to full and meaningful lives, providing free rehabilitation services to veterans and civilians.

patientsServed.label: Patients Served
patientsServed.description: Total number of patients served since establishment

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To help all people affected by the war in Ukraine return to full and meaningful lives. We are committed to ensuring that every defender receives high-quality rehabilitation, care, and support on their journey to recovery.

values.name: In God's Hands
values.description: We believe that under God's guidance, He grants us the strength and resources to restore every person harmed by war

values.name: Humanity
values.description: Treating every patient with empathy and respect

values.name: Sincerity
values.description: Communicating honestly and transparently with patients and partners

values.name: Dedication
values.description: Wholeheartedly serving the rehabilitation and well-being of our patients

values.name: Professionalism
values.description: Providing the highest standards of medical and rehabilitation services

team.title: Our Team
team.description: As of 2025, the medical center has 32+ professional employees, including:

treatmentPrograms.title: Treatment Programs
treatmentPrograms.description: We provide specialized treatment for various war-related injuries:

programs.name: Mine Blast Injuries
programs.description: Specialized treatment for complex injuries caused by landmines and explosive devices

programs.name: Shrapnel and Gunshot Wounds
programs.description: Managing penetrating wounds and shrapnel injuries from combat

programs.name: Musculoskeletal Injuries
programs.description: Rehabilitation for bone, muscle, and joint damage

programs.name: Limb Amputation
programs.description: Prosthetic fitting and post-amputation rehabilitation training

programs.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
programs.description: Psychological therapy and support for war trauma

programs.name: Anxiety Disorders
programs.description: Professional psychological counseling for anxiety and emotional disorders

successStories.title: Reclaiming the Motorcycle Dream
successStories.description: After losing his lower limbs, he dreamed of riding motorcycles again. We fitted him with prosthetics, and he not only learned to run but got back on a motorcycle, reclaiming his joy in life.

successStories.title: Fitting Prosthetics During Blackouts
successStories.description: During severe blackouts, we worked with flashlights and generators to ensure our defenders received their prosthetics on time.

successStories.title: From Wheelchair to Independent Walking
successStories.description: A patient who arrived in a wheelchair, unable to move their lower limbs, has now regained the ability to walk independently.

successStories.title: Hospital Visits to Plan Rehabilitation
successStories.description: We visit hospitals to support newly injured individuals, providing professional rehabilitation consultation and psychological support.

challenges.title: Shortage of Rehabilitation Resources
content: The demand for high-quality rehabilitation in Ukraine far exceeds available resources. The existing system cannot meet the actual needs of war-injured individuals and veterans.

There are currently about 30 specialized rehabilitation centers serving war victims, capable of receiving about 27,000 patients annually. However, the total number of war-injured individuals and veterans is approximately 360,000 (official data from the Ukrainian President).

At the current capacity, each injured person would need to wait approximately 13.5 years to complete a single rehabilitation course. The rehabilitation sector urgently needs massive support, as the well-being of Ukraine's defenders depends on it.

financialStatus.title: Operating Scale and Financial Status
financialStatus.description: Since its establishment in 2022, Way to Health has continuously expanded to serve more war-injured individuals. Despite receiving charitable donations and government compensation, operating costs far exceed income, facing significant funding gaps each year.

categories.name: Payroll
categories.description: Doctors, physical therapists, psychologists, nurses, and other professionals

categories.name: Administrative Costs
categories.description: Office supplies, utilities, software licenses, coffee, etc.

callToAction.title: We Need Your Support
callToAction.content: Every donation helps rebuild a life. Your support will be used for:

purposes.title: Keeping the rehabilitation center free and expanding its capacity
purposes.description: Ensuring every person harmed by war can access free, professional rehabilitation services, and helping us expand our capacity to serve more patients

purposes.title: Covering website operations and charitable project implementation costs
purposes.description: Maintaining this transparent donation platform so that supporters worldwide can easily contribute to helping Ukrainian war victims

callToAction.closing: The war continues, but rehabilitation cannot wait. 360,000 injured individuals are still waiting for treatment, and your every act of kindness brings them hope of returning to normal life. No matter the amount, your donation will directly change someone's destiny.

partners.title: Partner Ecosystem
partners.description: Way to Health is not just a medical center providing high-quality rehabilitation services, but an important social project. Its ecosystem includes the Way to Health Medical Center, Way to Health Charitable Foundation, the Dutch charity A Warm Heart for Way to Health, and other foundations and business partners. Thanks to their support, the project can provide completely free services to war victims.

partners.name: A Warm Heart for Way to Health
Superhumans Center
partners.description: Superhumans Center - prosthetic and rehabilitation medical institution directly supported by Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska

hospitalVisits.title: Hospital Visit Program
hospitalVisits.description: We visit hospitals to support those who have just experienced limb amputation, providing them with emotional support and hope for comprehensive rehabilitation.

faithBased.title: Faith Foundation
faithBased.quote: The main partner of Way to Health is the Lord. His support inspires us daily to help the injured, rehabilitate those affected by war, and bring hope to those in need. We believe that under God's guidance, He grants us the strength and resources to restore every person harmed by war and lead them on the path to health.

progressGallery.title: Treatment Progress
progressGallery.description: Documenting the treatment journey of patients from injury to recovery
